p: Utility systems such as power supplies are unlikely to be affected during coldest conditions observed in the UK [ 37, 38]. Other infrastructure, particularly transport systems, are likely to be disrupted by snow and ice, creating difficulties of access for patients needing to use health facilities and for domiciliary care staff in reaching their clients in their homes [ 37, 51â€“ 54]. Ambulance response times also fall during very cold weather [ 45].
